item.title: 美联储放宽利率半点后，美国利率期货暗示到 2024 年底将下调 76 个基点
item.description: LSEG 的计算显示，衡量银行间无担保隔夜贷款成本的联邦基金利率期货周三已将美联储年底前额外降息约 76 个基点纳入定价。【原文：Futures on the fed funds rate, which measures the cost of unsecured overnight loans between banks, have priced in on Wednesday about 76 basis points of additional rate cuts by the Federal Reserve by the end of the year, LSEG calculations showed.】

item.title: VIEW 美联储自大流行病肆虐以来首次放宽政策，将利率下调 50 个基点
item.description: 美联储周三将利率下调了半个百分点，开启了预期中的稳步宽松货币政策的序幕，借贷成本的降幅超过了往常，这也是对就业市场健康状况日益感到不安之后的又一举措。【原文：The Federal Reserve cut interest rates by half of a percentage point on Wednesday, kicking off what is expected to be a steady easing of monetary policy with a larger-than-usual reduction in borrowing costs that followed growing unease about the health of the job market.】

item.title: 美联储在选举年做了什么？利率变动比不变动更频繁
item.description: 美联储周三决定将利率下调半个百分点，这是近半个世纪以来该央行在美国总统大选前夕最接近启动宽松周期的一次。【原文：The Federal Reserve's decision to cut interest rates by half a percentage point on Wednesday marked the closest the central bank has come in launching an easing cycle on the cusp of a U.S. presidential election in nearly half a century.】

item.title: 美联储决策者预测 2024 年底政策利率为 4.4
item.description: 美国央行行长们认为，随着通胀率接近 2% 的目标，失业率上升，他们需要在年底前将利率下调至 4.25%-4.50% 的区间，这超过了他们在 6 月份时的预期。【原文：U.S. central bankers think they’ll need to lower interest rates to a range of 4.25%-4.50% by year-end, more than they anticipated in June, as inflation approaches their 2% goal and unemployment rises.】

item.title: 美联储鲍曼提出异议，这是 2005 年以来美联储理事首次提出异议
item.description: 美联储理事米歇尔-鲍曼（Michelle Bowman）周三成为自2005年以来首位对美国央行的利率决定投反对票的美联储理事，使美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）在关键时刻无法达成明确的共识。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman on Wednesday became the first Fed governor to vote against an interest-rate decision by the U.S. central bank since 2005, denying Fed Chair Jerome Powell a clear consensus at a pivotal moment.】

item.title: Stellantis 在全国罢工一年后面临史无前例的 UAW 罢工
item.description: 在底特律三大汽车制造商因全国性罢工而损失数十亿美元并导致 50,000 名工人停工约一年后，美国汽车工人联合会（United Auto Workers union）正考虑在美国对法国-意大利汽车制造商 Stellantis 进行多次罢工。【原文：The United Auto Workers union is eying multiple U.S. strikes against French-Italian carmaker Stellantis about a year after a national walkout cost the Detroit Three automakers billions of dollars and idled 50,000 workers.】

item.title: 会议记录显示，加拿大央行成员对通胀前景看法不一
item.description: 作者：Promit Mukherjee 和 David Ljunggren【原文：By Promit Mukherjee and David Ljunggren】

item.title: 美国前国务卿克里呼吁制定新的贸易规则并与中国开展气候合作
item.description: 美国前国务卿约翰-克里（John Kerry）周三敦促重新审视全球贸易规则，称现有的贸易争端调解机构世界贸易组织（World Trade Organization）已被 "阉割"。【原文：Former U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry on Wednesday urged a new look at global trade rules, calling the existing mediator of trade disputes, the World Trade Organization, "neutered."】

item.title: 万豪首席执行官称，公司正密切关注低收入旅客消费放缓是否会持续
item.description: 万豪国际集团首席执行官安东尼-卡普阿诺（Anthony Capuano）周三表示，公司正在关注低收入消费者旅游支出放缓的趋势在第三季度是否会持续。【原文：Marriott International's Chief Executive Officer Anthony Capuano said on Wednesday that the company is watching if the slowdown in travel spending from lower-income consumers will hold in the third-quarter.】

item.title: 备忘录显示，摩根大通以新角色应对华尔街对工作过度的担忧
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase）设立了一个新职位，负责监督其初级银行家和分析师，以解决华尔街长期存在的过度工作问题。【原文：JPMorgan Chase has created a new role that will oversee its junior bankers and analysts amid a focus to tackle the persistent problem of overworking on Wall Street.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，谷歌在欧盟反垄断调查中提出出售广告市场 AdX
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司今年早些时候提出出售其广告市场 AdX，以缓解欧盟对其广告技术做法的竞争担忧，但两名直接知情人士表示，这一提议遭到了欧洲出版商的冷遇。【原文：Alphabet's Google earlier this year offered to sell its advertising marketplace AdX to allay EU competition concerns over its adtech practices but the proposal got short shrift from European publishers, two people with direct knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 马斯克的特斯拉、SpaceX 和 X 公司的员工向哈里斯捐款，而他却支持特朗普
item.description: 亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）支持共和党前总统唐纳德-特朗普竞选白宫，但他旗下公司的员工却大多向特朗普的民主党竞争对手卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）捐款。【原文：Billionaire Elon Musk has endorsed Republican former President Donald Trump in the race for the White House, but employees at his collection of companies are largely donating to Trump's Democratic rival Kamala Harris.】

item.title: 波音公司将临时解雇大批美国高管
item.description: 波音公司首席执行官凯利-奥特伯格（Kelly Ortberg）周三表示，在约3万名机械师周五举行罢工，导致737 MAX和其他飞机停产后，这家飞机制造商将临时解雇众多美国高管和其他员工。【原文：Boeing CEO Kelly Ortberg said Wednesday the planemaker will temporarily furlough numerous U.S. executives and other employees after about 30,000 machinists went on strike Friday, halting production of its 737 MAX and other airplanes.】

item.title: 德意志银行称，美国融资利率飙升可能预示着计算中的 "怪异 "现象
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank）表示，美国关键的隔夜融资利率最近出现跳升，可能是计算方式的特殊性造成的，而不是流动性不足的信号。【原文：A recent jump in a key U.S. overnight funding rate could be the result of a peculiarity in the way it is calculated, rather than a signal of low liquidity, said Deutsche Bank.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会称 Gamestop 首席执行官科恩将支付近 100 万美元罚款
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会周三表示，RC Ventures LLC 管理合伙人、Gamestop 首席执行官 Ryan Cohen 将支付近 100 万美元的罚款，以了结与他收购 Wells Fargo & Co 股份有关的反垄断法违规行为。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission said on Wednesday that Ryan Cohen, managing partner of RC Ventures LLC and Gamestop CEO, would pay a nearly $1 million penalty to settle an antitrust law violation related to his acquisition of Wells Fargo & Co shares.】

item.title: 亚马逊提高美国履行和运输业务小时工的工资
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com）周三表示，该公司将投资超过 22 亿美元，用于提高其在美国执行和运输业务的小时工的薪酬。【原文：Amazon.com will invest more than $2.2 billion to bump up the pay of hourly workers in its fulfillment and transportation operations in the United States, the company said on Wednesday.】

item.title: YouTube 与 Shopee 合作开展东南亚电子商务合作
item.description: Alphabet Inc.旗下的YouTube和电子商务平台Shopee周三表示，它们将在印度尼西亚推出在线购物服务，并计划将其扩展到东南亚地区，因为与TikTok旗下的竞争对手运营商的竞争日趋激烈。【原文：Alphabet Inc's YouTube and e-commerce platform Shopee said on Wednesday they were launching an online shopping service in Indonesia and planned to expand it in Southeast Asia as competition picks up with a rival operator owned by TikTok.】

item.title: Facebook 母公司 Meta Platforms 打赢有关苹果隐私和桑德伯格披露信息的官司
item.description: Meta Platforms 赢得了一项诉讼的撤诉，该诉讼称 Meta Platforms 通过隐瞒苹果隐私设置的变更将如何降低 Facebook 和 Instagram 对广告商的吸引力而欺骗了股东。【原文：Meta Platforms won the dismissal of a lawsuit claiming it defrauded shareholders by concealing how changes to Apple's privacy settings would make Facebook and Instagram less desirable for advertisers.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会准备允许半仙股票定价
item.description: 华尔街最高监管机构周三公布规定，允许股票市场以半美分为单位定价，而不是目前的最低1美分，旨在促进更具竞争力的定价，降低投资者成本。【原文：Wall Street's top regulator on Wednesday unveiled rules allowing stock markets to price shares in increments of half a penny, rather than the current minimum size of 1 cent, aiming to promote more competitive pricing and reduce investor costs.】

item.title: 阿拉斯加首席执行官认为波音公司在门塞事件后有 "重大改进
item.description: 阿拉斯加航空公司（Alaska Airlines）首席执行官本-米尼库奇（Ben Minicucci）表示，近几个月来，这家陷入困境的飞机制造商波音公司（Boeing）已经取得了 "重大改进"，今年 1 月，该公司一架新型 737 MAX 9 喷气式飞机在 16000 英尺的高空被一个缺少关键螺栓的门塞炸毁。【原文：Alaska Airlines CEO Ben Minicucci said the airline has seen "significant improvement" at troubled planemaker Boeing in recent months after a door plug missing key bolts blew off one of the carrier's new 737 MAX 9 jets at 16,000 feet in January.】

item.title: 监管机构称，经纪商 First Horizon 将支付罚款以了结美国证券交易委员会的指控
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission）周三在一份声明中表示，经纪自营商 First Horizon Advisors, Inc 已同意就其推荐的某些产品支付 32.5 万美元的民事罚款。【原文：Broker-dealer First Horizon Advisors, Inc has agreed to pay a civil penalty of $325,000 in connection with its recommendations for certain products, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission said in a statement on Wednesday.】

item.title: 葛兰素史克就两起与胃灼热药物 Zantac 相关的加州诉讼达成和解
item.description: 英国制药商葛兰素史克公司（GSK）周三表示，它已同意与加利福尼亚州的两起诉讼达成和解，这两起诉讼声称其已停产的胃灼热药善达克（Zantac）会致癌。【原文：British drugmaker GSK said on Wednesday it had agreed to settle two lawsuits in California that claimed its discontinued heartburn drug Zantac caused cancer.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，大众汽车与合资伙伴上汽集团计划关闭中国工厂
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周三援引知情人士的话报道，由于内燃机汽车需求放缓，大众汽车及其中国合资伙伴上汽集团计划关闭至少一家在华工厂。【原文：Volkswagen and its Chinese joint venture partner SAIC plan to close at least one plant in China due to slow demand for combustion engine cars, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 阿拉斯加航空公司完成收购夏威夷航空公司
item.description: 阿拉斯加航空公司（Alaska Airlines）周三表示，在与美国交通部达成协议后，该公司已完成对夏威夷航空公司（Hawaiian Airlines）价值 19 亿美元的收购。【原文：Alaska Airlines said Wednesday it has completed its $1.9 billion acquisition of Hawaiian Airlines after it reached agreement with the U.S. Transportation Department.】

item.title: 谷歌敦促法庭撤销价值 93 亿美元的英国搜索 "主导地位 "诉讼案
item.description: 谷歌母公司 Alphabet 周三要求伦敦一家法庭撤销一项大规模诉讼，该诉讼指控这家科技巨头滥用其在网络搜索市场的主导地位。【原文：Google parent Alphabet on Wednesday asked a London tribunal to throw out a mass lawsuit that accuses the tech giant of abusing its dominance in the online search market.】

item.title: AIR COMPANY 在新一轮融资中获得 Avfuel 和阿拉斯加航空公司的支持
item.description: 气候技术公司 AIR COMPANY 表示，该公司在最新一轮融资中获得了航空燃料供应商 Avfuel 的支持，希望将二氧化碳转化为一系列更加气候友好型产品。【原文：Climate technology firm AIR COMPANY said it has secured backing from aviation fuel supplier Avfuel in its latest funding round as it looks to convert carbon dioxide into a range of more climate-friendly products.】

item.title: 美国 8 月独户住宅新开工面积激增
item.description: 8 月份，美国单户住宅建设大幅反弹，许可证数量也有所增加，但新房供应量的增加给建筑商带来了挑战。【原文：U.S. single-family homebuilding rebounded sharply in August and permits increased, but rising new housing supply poses a challenge for builders.】

item.title: 罗杰斯将以 34.6 亿美元收购贝尔在枫叶公司的股份
item.description: 罗杰斯通讯公司（Rogers Communications）周三表示，该公司已签署协议，将以 47 亿加元（34.6 亿美元）的价格收购贝尔持有的枫叶体育与娱乐公司（MLSE）37.5% 的股权。【原文：Rogers Communications said on Wednesday it had signed an agreement to buy Bell's 37.5% ownership stake in Maple Leaf Sports & Entertainment (MLSE) for C$4.7 billion ($3.46 billion).】

item.title: 花旗调查显示，富裕家庭越来越看好风险资产
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup）的一项调查显示，富裕家庭正在寻求风险资产，减少现金持有量，因为他们更加看好投资前景。【原文：Wealthy families are seeking out risky assets and reducing cash holdings as they turn more bullish about the investment outlook, according to a Citigroup survey.】

item.title: 信中显示，CVC敦促德国铁路公司重新考虑将全球国际货运出售给DSV的事宜
item.description: 路透社周三看到的一封信显示，金融投资者CVC正敦促德国国有铁路企业集团德国铁路公司（DBN.UL）重新考虑以160亿美元向丹麦DSV公司出售物流部门全球国际货运公司（Schenker）的交易，并对该交易的基本计算方法提出了批评。【原文：Financial investor CVC is urging German state railway conglomerate Deutsche Bahn (DBN.UL) to reconsider its $16-billion sale of logistics arm Schenker to Denmark's DSV , a letter seen by Reuters showed on Wednesday, criticising underlining calculations for the deal.】
